intro: Stathmostelma katangense, commonly known as the Katanga thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has a compact, shrub-like structure. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The flowers are arranged in dense clusters, making it an attractive plant for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
